alert.note: Alert for Kankakee; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 5:14PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST/8 PM EST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following areas, in Illinois, Ford, Iroquois, Kankakee and Livingston. In northwest Indiana, Benton, Jasper and Newton. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CST /800 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Poor drainage areas and fields may flood. Slow moving or standing water will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM CST /555 PM EST/, local law enforcement reported standing water on numerous roadways in the vicinity of Gibson City. Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen since this morning, with the heaviest rainfall occurring along and near a line from Gibson City to Milford. - Rainfall is beginning to diminish from west to east across the advisory area. Some locations may still receive an additional half inch of accumulation. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rensselaer, Watseka, Paxton, Fairbury, Gibson City, Fowler, Gilman, Kentland, Clifton, Milford, Otterbein, Chatsworth, Remington, Morocco, Onarga, Forrest, Oxford, Sheldon, Goodland and Brook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
